content.question: A cylindrical container has two small tubes of the same size, each with a valve that can be opened, as shown in the figure. The diameter of the container is very large compared to the diameter of the tubes. Tube <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is at the bottom of the container and Tube <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> above the bottom of the container. With the valves closed, the container is filled with a fluid to a depth <math alttext="2 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></math>. The valve on Tube <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is opened and the fluid initially exits the tube at a speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The valve on Tube <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is then closed and the container is refilled to a depth <math alttext="2 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></math> with the same fluid. When the valve on Tube <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is opened, the fluid initially exits with a speed <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 1 is less than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="v sub 1 equals v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
The speeds cannot be compared without knowing the density of the fluid.

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
